generalProcessHelp:
The general process to follow for compiling, exporting, and deploying contracts is as follows:

1. First, you need to make sure that you your simba.json file is correctly configured with all necessary fields. For information on what should be contained in simba.json, please run

	$ npx hardhat simba help simbajson

2. Next, you'll need to login to SIMBA Chain. To do so, run

	$ npx hardhat simba login

Then follow the prompts to choose your organization and application.

3. Then, you will need to compile your contracts (this can also be done before you login). To compile your contracts, run

	$ npx hardhat compile

4. Next, you will need to export your contract. What this will do is save your contract to your organization's saved contracts on simbachain.com. To export, run $ npx hardhat simba export, then follow the prompts to select which contract you want to export. For more information on export, run $ npx hardhat simba help export.

5. Finally, to deploy your contract, which will save the contract to your application and create API endpoints for the contract's methods, you will run

	$ npx hardhat simba deploy

For more information on deploying, run

	$ npx hardhat simba help deploy

6. If you would like to logout, which deletes your auth token info in authconfig.json, just run

	$ npx hardhat simba logout
simbaJsonHelp:
Before you are able to do anything like login, export, or deploy, your simba.json file will need to be configured properly, as follows.

1. baseURL: this is the base URL that your organization and application live at. An example would be 'https://simba-dev-api.platform.simbachain.com/v2'

2. realm: this is the keycloak realm for your account. An example would be 'simbachain'.

3. web3Suite: this field should be 'hardhat'.

4. artifact_directory: This is the directory where your compiled contracts from hardhat live. An example would be '/Users/jonny/development/hardhat/artifacts'
loginHelp:
Once you have configured your simba.json file, you will be able to login. the hardhat plugin uses keycloack device login, so you will be given a URL that you can navigate to, to grant permission to your device. You will then be prompted to select the organization and application from SIMBA Chain that you wish to log into. To log in, simply run

	$ npx hardhat simba login
exportHelp:
Once you have logged in, you will be able to export your contracts, which will save them to your organization's contracts. When exporting, you will be asked to select the primary contract that you want to deploy. To export, run

	$ npx hardhat simba export

If you run into a situation in which the Simba plugin is not asking you to specify which primary contract you want to export, then navigate to your simba.json file and delete the field and value for 'primary' and then rerun the above command
deployHelp:
After you have logged in and exported your contract, you will be able to deploy your contract. This step will generate the REST API endpoints that you can use to interact with your smart contract's methods, and save them to your organization and app. You will then be able to access those endpoints through either the Blocks (Simba Chain) UI, or programatically through one of Simba's SDKs. To deploy, run

	$ npx hardhat simba deploy

You will then be prompted to:

	1. choose how you want to specify your contract's constructor parameters (as either a JSON object or one by one)

	2. choose an API name for your contract

	3. select the blockchain you want to deploy to

	4. choose which storage to use (AWS, Azure, etc., but this depends on what you have configured for your account)

	5. and finally, you will be asked to provide the parameters for your contract constructor, based on the response you gave to the first prompt
logoutHelp:
If you want to logout, then you can do so by running

	$ npx hardhat simba logout

Doing so will delete your auth token in authconfig.json
